descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...1 complete unique shape object and 2 incomplete object with multi color
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid to make the output you have to copy the input grid then complete the shape of the object
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use the unique shaped grids and fill the incomplete with the unique shape

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...much nice one
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... good nice one
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...nice one of the game

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...23 shapes, grids with the same color to form a T, grids with the same color to form a U and the same for a square but with single or multiple grids to form a shape..
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...does not change.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use the square shaped grids and replicate it with the T and U by not minimizing the square to the size of the T and the U but rather on its original size and the number of used grids, but by ignoring the common color in the shape T or U and the square shaped grids.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... 1 or 2 rectangular 2-color objects, and another 2-color object with a unique shape. All objects share one of their colors.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size... is the same as the input grid.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... copy the input grid. Then, "apply" the unique object's shape to the rectangular shape. Use the color that all the objects have in common to figure out the size. If the unique object has 1 block of the shared color, and the rectangular object has a 2x2 block of the shared color, then you will have to double the size of the shape to "fit" it to the rectangular shape. Each shape should maintain its color scheme.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two or three shapes, one of which is bigger, and at least one that's a T, or U shape.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...does not change.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...recreate the shapes, the T or U in the same direction it's facing, but the size has to increase by 2 times.  The placement stay the same.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...23 shapes, grids with the same color to form a T, grids with the same color to form a U and the same for a square but with single or multiple grids to form a shape.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...should remain the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...use the square shape grids and replicate it with the  T and U by not decreasing  the square to the size of the T and the U but rather on its original size and the number of used grids, but by ignore the common color in the shape T or U and the square shaped grids.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...make a blue color add extra 6 time
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...green color change to red color
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...yellow add extra three times

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...2-3 shapes of either a pixel bar, 5 pixel shape which goes in a  direction, or cross shape.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...add a green top, bottom and left pixel to the red green 2 pixel bar. Add a 2x2 yellow block to the bottom and 4x2 yellow block to the left of the red and yellow 2x4 yellow and red block. Leave the red middle of blue left facing direction shape the same. Add a 1x3 pink to the right of the 2x1 pink bar and 1 pixel of pink to the right. Add a 4x4 block of yellow to the top, bottom and left of the yellow an blue 4x2 block. The yellow surrounded by blue  should be left the same and copy this shape for the yellow surrounded by light blue 3x6 shape.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... 1 or 2 rectangular objects and another object with a unique shapes
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as the input grid
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid then apply unique objects to shape to the rectangular shape

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two or three shapes, one of which is big, and at least one that's is a T, or U shape.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...does not change
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...recreate the full shapes, the T, or U, in the same direction it's facing. The single space in a given image will be the same as I recreate each shape and nothing moves. So if the single space in blue, the rest of the colors in the shapes will be the other color. I just create the shape from around what's given to I have that spot.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see... two or three shapes, one of which is bigger, and at least one that's is a T,   or U shape.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...does not change.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...recreate the full shapes, the T,   or U, in the same direction it's facing. The single space in a given image will be the same as you recreate each shape and nothing moves. So if the single space is blue, the rest of the colors in the shapes will be the other color. You just create the shape from around what's given to you in that spot.
